textbox_1:
Hello! Welcome to the 2nd 
Openscop Showcase!

This was originally meant to be a continuation of the original 
"Openscop Showcase" video.

However, in-between when that 
video was made and now, I 
rewrote Openscop's source-code.

This rewrite happened in 
November and December 2024.

This rewrite brought performance upgrades, new features, better 
code readability, and much more.

All that led me to the decision of
re-making the showcase video.

So I get to showcase the new 
codebase, the new features and 
re-introduce Openscop to people.

All that being said, let's get 
started!

Openscop is an open-source
recreation of [color=#FF00FF]Petscop[/color]!

Openscop runs on Godot 4.1.1, 
however it's fully compatible with 
newer versions.

Openscop is the result of the 
work of amazing folks. Their 
names are in the GitHub Wiki.

Openscop is meant to be used for 
making fan videos and also 
[color=#FF00FF]Petscop[/color] fangames.

What you see here is a small room
that showcases most features 
Openscop can offer.

P.S: NTSC filter was added on
post production.
dots_test:
I hope you are enjoying the 
showcase so far...
Now, look at this huge textbox. 
How much text fits in here? You 
should start thinking about that.
There's nothing here though, so we better get outta here.
textbox_2:
Oh well, this door is locked!
What might be on the other side?

On the next major update we will 
find out.

This has been a brief showcase of
what Openscop can offer.

Openscop can be downloaded at:
github.com/TechMan06/Openscop

Documentation links and project 
credits can also be found there.

We hope you enjoy and create
interesting fan content with this
project.

We would like to thank you for 
watching.
And we see you soon!

Though maybe there's still one 
last thing...

giftplane:
The Gift Plane has closed 
indefinitely, and all personnel 
have left.

If you are unaware, The Gift 
Plane provided homes to over a 
hundred young Pets.
Unfortunately, we have failed to remove all of the Pets from their homes.
[color=#FF0000]48[/color] Pets remain here, at the time of writing.

We would strongly encourage you to visit our [color=#FF0000]48[/color] homes and find 
some friends to take with you.

Every Pet is uniquely valuable. 
You should have no problem 
finding somebody that you love.

note_lina:
You must have guessed, but I 
was looking through your things.

I found that picture of you from
1977, standing in front of an 
old windmill with your friend.

You went there, and it was a bad
idea. Your friend and the windmill
both disappeared into thin air.

Her sister was holding the 
camera. She took another 
picture minutes later: just you, 
no windmill, and no friend.

You married her sister, and 
years later, your friend was 
reborn as your daughter.

Your wife won't admit this is 
true, but I know it, because I 
found the evidence.

Your friend never returned with
you, and the windmill was gone. I
went to see it myself. Where is 
it? What did you do?
